title: QUERY_ACCELERATION_HISTORY view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
The query acceleration service requires Enterprise Edition (or higher).
To inquire about upgrading, please contact Snowflake Support.

The QUERY_ACCELERATION_HISTORY view in the ORGANIZATION_USAGE schema is used for querying the history of queries accelerated
by the query acceleration service. The information returned by the view
includes the warehouse name and the credits consumed by the query acceleration service.
Name of the organization where the usage took place.
Name of the account where the usage took place.
Name of the region where the account is located.
Date (in the UTC time zone) when queries were accelerated.
Number of credits billed for the query acceleration service during the USAGE_DATE.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the warehouse that the queries were executed on.
Name of the warehouse that the queries were executed on.
Latency for the view may be up to 24 hours (1 day).
The data is retained for 365 days (1 year).
